Wrong views, right views, and the opposite, learners, and also post-learners,
Neither learners nor post-learners, brahma-patience, and five types.
What is wrong view? What is wrong cognition?
If it is wrong view, is it also wrong cognition?ğŸ”½If it is wrong cognition, is it also wrong view?
Are wrong views subsumed by wrong cognition? Are wrong cognitions subsumed by wrong views?ğŸ”½If one possesses wrong view, does one also possess wrong cognition?
If one possesses wrong cognition, does one also possess wrong view?ğŸ”½If wrong view has ceased without remainder, has wrong cognition also ceased?
If wrong cognition has ceased without remainder, has wrong view also ceased?
Questions, definitive principles, subsumption, possession, and cessation.
What is right view? What is right cognition?
If it is right view, is it also right cognition?

If it is knowledge of equality, is it the view of equality?ğŸ”½Are knowledge of equality and the view of equality mutually inclusive?ğŸ”½If one possesses the view of equality, does one also possess the knowledge of equality?
If one possesses the knowledge of equality, does one also possess the view of equality?ğŸ”½If the view of equality has ceased without remainder, does the knowledge of equality also cease?
If the knowledge of equality has ceased without remainder, does the view of equality also cease?
Questions, fixed principles, inclusion, possession, and cessation.
Are all perverse views also bonds?
If they are bonds, are they all perverse views?
What is the view of one in training? What is the knowledge of one in training? What is the wisdom of one in training?

If it is the view of one in training, is it the knowledge of one in training?ğŸ”½If it is the knowledge of one in training, is it the view of one in training?ğŸ”½Is the view of one in training also the wisdom of one in training?
If it is the wisdom of one in training, is it the view of one in training?ğŸ”½Is the knowledge of one in training also the wisdom of one in training?
If it is the wisdom of one in training, is it the knowledge of one in training?

Do the learned views subsume the learned cognition, or do the learned cognition subsume the learned views?ğŸ”½Do the learned views subsume the learned wisdom, or do the learned wisdom subsume the learned views?
Do the learned cognition subsume the learned wisdom, or do the learned wisdom subsume the learned cognition?

If one possesses the learned views, does one also possess the learned cognition?ğŸ”½If one possesses the learned cognition, does one also possess the learned views?ğŸ”½If one possesses the learned views, does one also possess the learned wisdom?
If one possesses the learned wisdom, does one also possess the learned views?ğŸ”½If one possesses the learned cognition, does one also possess the learned wisdom?
If one possesses the learned wisdom, does one also possess the learned cognition?
The questions, definitions, subsumption, and possession are presented.
What is the non-learner's view? What is the non-learner's cognition? What is the non-learner's wisdom?
Is the non-learner's view the non-learner's cognition?ğŸ”½If it is the non-learner's cognition, is it the non-learner's view?ğŸ”½Is the non-learner's view the non-learner's wisdom?
If it is the non-learner's wisdom, is it the non-learner's view?
If it is the knowledge of the adept, is it the wisdom of the adept?
If it is the wisdom of the adept, is it the knowledge of the adept?ğŸ”½Are the views of the adept included in the knowledge of the adept?
Are the knowledge of the adept included in the views of the adept?
Are the wisdom of the adept included in the views of the adept, and are the views of the adept included in the wisdom of the adept?
Are the knowledge of the adept included in the wisdom of the adept, and are the wisdom of the adept included in the knowledge of the adept?

If one possesses the views of the adept, does one possess the knowledge of the adept?ğŸ”½If one possesses the knowledge of the adept, does one possess the views of the adept?ğŸ”½If one possesses the views of the adept, does one possess the wisdom of the adept?
If one possesses the wisdom of the adept, does one possess the views of the adept?ğŸ”½If one possesses the knowledge of the adept, does one possess the wisdom of the adept?
If one possesses the wisdom of the adept, does one possess the knowledge of the adept?
Questions, definitive principles, inclusion, and possession.
What is the view that is neither learner nor non-learner? What is the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner? What is the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner?

Is the view that is neither learner nor non-learner also the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner?ğŸ”½If it is the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner, is it also the view that is neither learner nor non-learner?ğŸ”½Is the view that is neither learner nor non-learner also the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner?

If it is the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner, is it also the view that is neither learner nor non-learner?ğŸ”½Is the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner also the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner?

If it is the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner, is it also the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner?ğŸ”½Are the views that are neither learner nor non-learner included in the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner?ğŸ”½Are the knowledge that is neither learner nor non-learner included in the views that are neither learner nor non-learner?
Are the views that are neither learner nor non-learner included in the wisdom that is neither learner nor non-learner?
Are non-learner and non-non-learner views included in non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?

Are non-learner and non-non-learner knowledges included in non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?ğŸ”½If non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom includes non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge,ğŸ”½if one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner views, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge?ğŸ”½If one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner views?
If one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner views, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?

If one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner views?ğŸ”½If one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?
If one possesses non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom, do they possess non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge?
If non-learner and non-non-learner views have already ceased without remainder, are they non-learner and non-non-learner knowledge?

If non-learner non-non-learner knowledge has already ceased without remainder, is that non-learner non-non-learner view?ğŸ”½If non-learner non-non-learner view has already ceased without remainder, is that non-learner non-non-learner wisdom?
If non-learner non-non-learner wisdom has already ceased without remainder, is that non-learner non-non-learner view?
If non-learner non-non-learner knowledge has already ceased without remainder, is that non-learner non-non-learner wisdom?
If non-learner non-non-learner wisdom has already ceased without remainder, is that non-learner non-non-learner knowledge?
Questions, fixed principles, inclusion, attainment, and cessation.
As that Brahma said:
I am the great Brahma, the creator, the transformer, the producer, the nourisher, the father of all that have been and shall be.
Among these five views, which view is this?
By which truth is this view eliminated?
As that Brahma-kaiya god said:
This Brahma is the great Brahma, the creator, the transformer, the producer, the nourisher, the father of all that have been and shall be.
Among these five views, which view is it?
By which truth is this view eliminated?
As that long-nailed brahman said:
Gautama!
I cannot bear everything;
I can bear everything.
As for bearing and not bearing, among these five views, which view is it?
By which truth is this view eliminated?
Namely, this view: the arhat loses impurity, his form is the body of the demon-god Magha.
The arhat loses impurity, among these five views, which view is it?
By which truth is this view eliminated?
Namely, this view: the arhat himself is liberated but does not know it.
The arhat himself is liberated but doubts it, and only knows he has attained arhatship through others.
Among these five views, which view is it?
By which truth is this view eliminated?
Namely, this view: the five paths of suffering are only suffering.
Among these five views, which view is it?
By what kind of truth is this view eliminated?
I wish to hear a full explanation of the meaning of this chapter.
What is wrong view? What is wrong cognition?
What is wrong view?
Answer:
The meaning of the five views being indeterminate is that the five views are all wrong views.
If it is definite, it refers to the view that there is no giving, no retribution, and no teaching. This is called wrong view.
What is wrong cognition?
Answer:
Defiled wisdom associated with the mind of conceptualization, and defiled wisdom associated with the five sense consciousnesses. This is called wrong cognition.
If it is wrong view, is it wrong cognition?
Answer:
Yes, wrong view is wrong cognition.
Can there be wrong cognition that is not wrong view?
Answer:
Yes, excluding the five views, the remaining defiled wisdom associated with the mind of conceptualization, and defiled wisdom associated with the five sense consciousnesses.
Are wrong cognitions included in wrong views? Are wrong views included in wrong cognitions?
Answer:
Wrong knowledge includes wrong views, but wrong views do not include wrong knowledge.
What does it not include?
The answer is:
Apart from the five views, the defiled wisdom associated with the other mental consciousnesses and the defiled wisdom associated with the five consciousnesses.
If one possesses wrong views, does one also possess wrong knowledge?
The answer is:
It is like this, if one possesses wrong views, one also possesses wrong knowledge.
Can one possess wrong knowledge but not wrong views?
The answer is:
Yes, one who is a learner and has attained the state beyond training.
If wrong views have already ceased without remainder, does that mean wrong knowledge has also ceased?
The answer is:
It is like this, if wrong knowledge has already ceased without remainder, then wrong views have also ceased.
Can it be that wrong views have already ceased without remainder, but not wrong knowledge?
The answer is:
Yes, one who is a learner and has attained the state beyond training.
[This chapter discusses] questions, fixed principles, inclusion, possession, and cessation.ğŸ”½What is right view? What is right knowledge?
What is right view?
The answer is:
The wholesome wisdom associated with the mental consciousness body that is not included in the knowledge of elimination and non-arising.
What is knowledge of sameness?
Answer:

Except for the receptivities cultivated in the path of seeing, the other wholesome wisdom associated with the mental consciousness body, and the wholesome wisdom associated with the five consciousness bodies.
Is knowledge of sameness the same as right view?
Answer:
There may be right view that is not knowledge of sameness.
What is right view that is not knowledge of sameness?
Answer:
The receptivities cultivated in the path of seeing - this is right view that is not knowledge of sameness.
What is knowledge of sameness that is not right view?
Answer:
The wholesome wisdom associated with the five consciousness bodies, the knowledge of elimination, and the knowledge of non-arising - this is knowledge of sameness that is not right view.
What is knowledge of sameness that is also right view?
Answer:

Except for the receptivities cultivated in the path of seeing, the knowledge of elimination, and the knowledge of non-arising, the other wholesome wisdom associated with the mental consciousness body - this is knowledge of sameness that is also right view.
What is neither knowledge of sameness nor right view?
Answer:
Excluding the above cases.
Are all equalities of views included in equalities of cognition?
Answer:
There are equalities of views that are not equalities of cognition.
What are equalities of views that are not equalities of cognition?
Answer:
The acceptance of what is to be practiced is called equalities of views that are not equalities of cognition.
What are equalities of cognition that are not equalities of view?
Answer:

The wholesome cognition associated with the five groups of consciousness, the cognition of exhaustion, and the cognition of non-arising are called equalities of cognition that are not equalities of views.
What are equalities of views and equalities of cognition?
Answer:

Excluding the acceptance of what is to be practiced, the cognition of exhaustion, and the cognition of non-arising, the remaining wholesome cognition associated with the mental group of consciousness are called equalities of views and equalities of cognition.
What are not equalities of views and not equalities of cognition?
Answer:
Excluding the above, this is the case.
Attainment and cessation are also like this.
Questions, fixed principles, inclusion, attainment, and cessation.
Are all perverse cognitions bonds?
Answer:ğŸ”½There are perverse cognitions that are not bonds.
What are perverse cognitions that are not bonds?
Answer:
Excluding two fetters, view and doubt, the remaining defiled wisdom is called perverse wisdom but not a fetter.
What are fetters but not perverse wisdom?
Answer:
The seven fetters are called fetters but not perverse wisdom.
What are perverse wisdom and fetters?
Answer:
The two fetters are called perverse wisdom and fetters.
What are neither perverse wisdom nor fetters?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
What is learned view, what is learned knowledge, what is learned wisdom?
What is learned view?
Answer:
Learned wisdom.
What is learned knowledge?
Answer:
The eight kinds of learned knowledge.
What is learned wisdom?
Answer:
Learned view, learned knowledge, and learned wisdom are called this.
If it is a learned view, is it learned knowledge?
Answer:
In this way, learned knowledge is learned view.
Can there be a learned view that is not learned knowledge?
Answer:
Yes, the acceptance of practice.
If it is a learner's view, is it a learner's wisdom?
Answer:
So it is.
If it is a learner's wisdom, is it a learner's view?
Answer:
So it is.
If it is a learner's knowledge, is it a learner's wisdom?
Answer:
So it is, if it is a learner's knowledge, it is a learner's wisdom.
Can there be a learner's wisdom that is not a learner's knowledge?
Answer:
Yes, the acceptance of practice.
Are learner's views included in learner's knowledge, or are learner's knowledges included in learner's views?
Answer:
Learner's views include learner's knowledge, but learner's knowledge does not include learner's views.
What is not included?
Answer:
The acceptance of practice.
Are learner's views included in learner's wisdom?
Answer:
So it is.
Are learner's wisdoms included in learner's views?
Answer:
So it is.
Are learner's knowledges included in learner's wisdom, or are learner's wisdoms included in learner's knowledges?
Answer:
The wisdom of learning includes the knowledge of learning, but the knowledge of learning does not include the wisdom of learning.
What does it not include?
The answer is:
The acceptance of practice.
If one possesses the view of learning, does one possess the knowledge of learning?
The answer is:
It is the same. If one possesses the knowledge of learning, one possesses the view of learning.
Can one possess the view of learning without possessing the knowledge of learning?
The answer is:
Yes, when the acceptance of the truth of suffering is present.
If one possesses the view of learning, does one possess the wisdom of learning?
The answer is:
It is the same.
If one possesses the wisdom of learning, does one possess the view of learning?
The answer is:
It is the same.
If one possesses the knowledge of learning, does one possess the wisdom of learning?
The answer is:
It is the same. If one possesses the knowledge of learning, one possesses the wisdom of learning.
Can one possess the wisdom of learning without possessing the knowledge of learning?
The answer is:
Yes, when the acceptance of the truth of suffering is present.
Questions, definitive principles, inclusion, and possession.
What is the knowledge of the adept? What is the wisdom of the adept? What is the insight of the adept?
What is the insight of the adept?
Answer:
It is the undefiled wisdom not included in the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.
What is the knowledge of the adept?
Answer:
It is the eight knowledges of the adept.
What is the wisdom of the adept?
Answer:
It is the insight, knowledge, and wisdom of the adept.
Is the insight of the adept the knowledge of the adept?
Answer:
Yes, the insight of the adept is the knowledge of the adept.
Can there be knowledge of the adept that is not the insight of the adept?
Answer:
Yes, it is the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.
Is the knowledge of the adept the wisdom of the adept?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
Is the wisdom of the adept the knowledge of the adept?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
Are the knowledge and insight of the adept included in the wisdom of the adept?
Answer:
The knowledge of the adept includes the view of the adept, but the view of the adept does not include the knowledge of the adept.
What does it not include?
The answer is:
The knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of non-arising.
Does the view of the adept include the wisdom of the adept, and does the wisdom of the adept include the view of the adept?
The answer is:
The wisdom of the adept includes the view of the adept, but the view of the adept does not include the wisdom of the adept.
What does it not include?
The answer is:
The knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of non-arising.
Does the knowledge of the adept include the wisdom of the adept?
The answer is:
So it is.
Does the wisdom of the adept include the knowledge of the adept?
The answer is:
So it is.
The same is true for accomplishment.
Questions, fixed principles, inclusion, and accomplishment.
What is the view that is neither learner nor adept, what is the knowledge that is neither learner nor adept, what is the wisdom that is neither learner nor adept?
What is the view that is neither learner nor adept?
The answer is:
The eye faculty, the five views, and the worldly right views, etc.
What is knowledge that is neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
It is the wisdom associated with the mind faculty that is contaminated, and the wisdom associated with the five groups of consciousness.
What is wisdom that is neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
It is the wisdom associated with the mind faculty that is contaminated, and the wisdom associated with the five groups of consciousness.
If it is a view that is neither training nor post-training, is it knowledge that is neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
Sometimes it is a view but not knowledge.
What is a view but not knowledge?
Answer:
The eye faculty - this is a view but not knowledge.
What is knowledge but not a view?
Answer:

Excluding the five views and worldly right views, etc., the remaining wisdom associated with the mind faculty that is contaminated, and the wisdom associated with the five groups of consciousness - this is knowledge but not a view.
What is a view and also knowledge?
Answer:
The five views and worldly right views, etc. - this is a view and also knowledge.
What is neither view nor cognition?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
Is non-learner and non-non-learner view also non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?
Answer:
There is [view that is not wisdom].
What is view that is not wisdom?
Answer:
The eye faculty - this is view that is not wisdom.
What is wisdom that is not view?
Answer:

Excluding the five views and worldly right views, the remaining defiled wisdom associated with the mental consciousness and the wisdom associated with the five sense consciousnesses - this is wisdom that is not view.
What is view and also wisdom?
Answer:
The five views and worldly right views - this is view and also wisdom.
What is neither view nor wisdom?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
Is non-learner and non-non-learner cognition also non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?
Answer:
So it is.
If it is non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom, is it also non-learner and non-non-learner cognition?
Answer:
It is so.
Are the views of neither learner nor post-learner included in the knowledge of neither learner nor post-learner?
Answer:
Either views or not knowledge.
How are they views but not knowledge?
Answer:
The eye faculty - this is called views but not knowledge.
How is it knowledge but not views?
Answer:

Excluding the five views and worldly right views, the other defiled wisdom associated with the mental consciousness and the wisdom associated with the five sense consciousnesses - this is called knowledge but not views.
How are they both views and knowledge?
Answer:
The five views and worldly right views - this is called both views and knowledge.
How are they neither views nor knowledge?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
Are the views of neither learner nor post-learner included in the wisdom of neither learner nor post-learner?
Answer:
Either views or not wisdom.
How are they views but not wisdom?
Answer:
The eye faculty - this is called views but not wisdom.
How is it wisdom but not views?
Answer:

Excluding the five views and worldly right views, the remaining contaminated wisdom associated with the mental consciousness and the wisdom associated with the five consciousnesses - this is called wisdom that is not view.
What is view and wisdom?
Answer:
The five views and worldly right views - this is called view and wisdom.
What is neither view nor wisdom?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
Are non-learner and non-non-learner knowledges subsumed by non-learner and non-non-learner wisdom?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
Are non-learner and non-non-learner wisdoms subsumed by non-learner and non-non-learner knowledges?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
Possession and cessation are also like this.
Questions, fixed principles, subsumption, possession, and cessation.
As that Brahma said:

I am the great Brahma, the lord of this world, the maker, the transformer, the creator, the revealer, the first god, the most excellent, the lord, the ruler, the master, the father of all. This is stealing views, to be eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Creation means saying that what is not created is created. This is stealing precepts, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Wonderful means stealing inferior teachings as the best. This is stealing views, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Creating all kinds of beings means saying what is not created is created. This is stealing precepts, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Like the BrahmakÄyika gods who say:
This Brahma, the Great Brahma, is rich. Stealing inferior teachings as the best. This is stealing views, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Creating all kinds of beings means saying what is not created is created. This is stealing precepts, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Wonderful means stealing inferior teachings as the best. This is stealing views, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Creating all kinds of beings means saying what is not created is created. This is stealing precepts, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Like the DÄ«rghÄyu VÄlmÄ«ki ascetic who said:
Everything, Gautama!
I cannot bear it.
This is extreme view, included in annihilationism, eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Everything, Gautama!
I can endure.
This extreme view is included in the view of permanence and is to be eliminated by the truth of suffering.
I can endure the existence of self, but I cannot endure its non-existence.
As for enduring the existence of self, this extreme view is included in the view of permanence and is to be eliminated by the truth of suffering.
As for not enduring the non-existence of self, this extreme view is included in the view of annihilation and is to be eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Namely, this view that an arhat loses purity and his form is defiled by the god MÄra.
Saying that an arhat defiles the bedding with impurity and claims to have attained what has not been attained is stealing the precepts, to be eliminated by the truth of suffering.
Namely, this view that an arhat does not know his own liberation.
Saying that an arhat does not have this knowledge is wrong view, to be eliminated by the truth of the path.
Namely, this view that an arhat has doubts about his own liberation.
An arhat has already transcended doubts, this is wrong view, to be eliminated by the truth of the path.
Namely, this view that an arhat attains liberation through the knowledge of others.
The arhat does not know by others, this is wrong view, eliminated by the path of truth.

Namely, this view is called the path of suffering, the path of suffering, the seeds of the path, non-action is said to be action, this is stealing precepts, eliminated by the truth of suffering. Chapter 5 ends with the name.
The fourteenth section of the Abhidharma five-part treatise, 200 sÅ«tras in the Sanskrit version, 14 more characters, 3,549 characters in Qin.
The four of knowing others' minds, and love also has five,
Illuminating faith, extinguishing delusions, practicing samÄdhi and the path,
What is the knowledge of others' minds? What is the knowledge of past lives?ğŸ”½If it is the knowledge of others' minds, does it know others' minds?
If it knows others' minds, is it the knowledge of others' minds?ğŸ”½If it is the knowledge of past lives, does it know past lives?
If it knows past lives, is it the knowledge of past lives?
If it is the knowledge of past lives, does one know the thoughts and mental phenomena of others in the past?
If one knows the thoughts and mental phenomena of others in the past, is it the knowledge of past lives?
What is the liberation of equanimity of mind? What is the liberation of mind free from doubt?
For what reason is the liberation of equanimity of mind called love?ğŸ”½All liberations of equanimity of mind, are they all associated with the knowledge of destruction?

If they are all associated with the knowledge of destruction, are they all liberations of equanimity of mind?ğŸ”½All liberations of mind free from doubt, are they all associated with the knowledge of non-arising?
If they are all associated with the knowledge of non-arising, are they all liberations of mind free from doubt?
What is the illumination of a learner? What is the knowledge of a learner?
What is the illumination of a non-learner? What is the knowledge of a non-learner?
When practicing the Dharma, what faith does one first attain - in the Buddha, the Dharma, or the Saá¹…gha?
How many of these four inverted views are eliminated by a stream-enterer, and how many are not eliminated?

How many of these three samÄdhis are accomplished in the past, how many in the future, and how many in the present for a srota-Äpanna?ğŸ”½If a path is past, are all those paths already cultivated and already relied upon?
If a path is already cultivated and already relied upon, is all that path past?ğŸ”½If a path is future, are all those paths not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon?
If a path is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon, is all that path future?ğŸ”½If a path is present, are all those paths to be cultivated?
If a path is to be cultivated, is all that path present?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.
What is the knowledge of others' minds? What is the knowledge of past lives?
What is the knowledge of others' minds?
Answer:

If the wisdom that is cultivated and the fruit of cultivation, the wisdom that is remembered and not lost, and the wisdom that is presently used to know the thoughts, views, and practices of other beings and other people, and to know their mental nature as it really is, this is called the knowledge of others' minds.
What is the knowledge of past lives?
Answer:

If the wisdom that is cultivated and the fruit of cultivation, the wisdom that is remembered and not lost, and the wisdom that is presently used to remember one's past lives according to their characteristics, this is called the knowledge of past lives.
Is the knowledge of others' minds the knowledge of others' minds?
Answer:
Either it is the knowledge of others' minds but not the knowledge of others' minds.
What is the knowledge of others' minds but not the knowledge of others' minds?
Answer:
If the knowledge of others' minds is past or future, this is called the knowledge of others' minds but not the knowledge of others' minds.
What is the knowledge of others' minds but not the knowledge of others' minds?
Answer:
Thus, seeing such signs and hearing the words of others to know the minds of others, this is called knowing the minds of others but not knowing the minds of others through knowledge.
What is it to know the minds of others through knowledge and also to know the minds of others?
Answer:

If the knowledge that is cultivated is the fruit of cultivation, and one remembers what has been cultivated, obtains it without losing it, and uses the knowledge that is present to know the thoughts, natures, and practices of other beings and other people, this is called knowing the minds of others through knowledge and also knowing the minds of others.
What is it not to know the minds of others through knowledge and also not to know the minds of others?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
If it is the knowledge of one's past lives, does one then know one's past lives?
Answer:
Either it is the knowledge of one's past lives but one does not know one's past lives.
What is it to have the knowledge of one's past lives but not to know one's past lives?
Answer:
If the knowledge of past lives is past and future, it is called the knowledge of past lives that does not know past lives.
What is the knowledge of past lives that does not know past lives?
Answer:
Like the knowledge of past lives that arises, like the form and appearance that arises, this knowledge knows past lives, it is called the knowledge of past lives that does not know past lives.
What is the knowledge of past lives?
Does it know past lives?
Answer:

If the knowledge that is cultivated and the fruit of cultivation, remembers what has been cultivated and does not lose what has been attained, the knowledge that can be used is present, and according to its characteristics, it knows past lives countless times, it is called the knowledge of past lives that knows past lives.
What is not the knowledge of past lives that does not know past lives?
Answer:
Excluding the above.
If it is the knowledge of past lives, does it know the thoughts and dharmas in the minds of others in the past?
Answer:
Or it is the knowledge of past lives that does not know the thoughts and dharmas in the minds of others in the past.
How is it that the knowledge of past lives does not know the mental factors of others in the past?
Answer:

If the knowledge cultivated is the fruit of cultivation, remembering what has been cultivated, not losing what has been attained, and the knowledge that can be used is present, knowing the aggregates and sense bases of one's own past lives, this is called the knowledge of past lives that does not know the mental factors of others in the past.
How is it that the knowledge of the mental factors of others in the past is not the knowledge of past lives?
Answer:

If the knowledge cultivated is the fruit of cultivation, remembering what has been cultivated, not losing what has been attained, and the knowledge that can be used is present, knowing the aggregates and sense bases of the minds of other beings and other people in this life, this is called the knowledge of the mental factors of others in the past that is not the knowledge of past lives.
How is it that the knowledge of past lives also knows the mental factors of others in the past?
Answer:

If the wisdom that is cultivated and the fruit of cultivation, remembering what has been cultivated and not losing what has been attained, the wisdom that is presently used, the mind that has experienced the aggregates and sense bases of other beings and other persons in past lives, this is called the knowledge of past lives and also knowing the thoughts and mental states of others in the past.
What is neither the knowledge of past lives nor knowing the thoughts and mental states of others in the past?
Answer:

If the wisdom that is cultivated and the fruit of cultivation, remembering what has been cultivated and not losing what has been attained, the wisdom that is presently used, the mind that knows the aggregates and sense bases that one has experienced in this life in the past, this is called neither the knowledge of past lives nor knowing the thoughts and mental states of others in the past.
What is the liberation of equanimity of mind? What is the liberation of mind free from doubt?
What is the liberation of equanimity of mind?
Answer:

The liberation of equanimity of mind is the knowledge of extinction of an arhat, the liberation of mind associated with the unlearned view of equality, that which has been liberated, that which is being liberated, and that which will be liberated. This is called the liberation of equanimity of mind.
What is the liberation of the mind free from doubt?
Answer:

The liberation of the mind free from doubt refers to the mind liberation associated with the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising of an arhat, which is liberated, has been liberated, and will be liberated.
Why is the liberation of the mind of equanimity called loved?
Answer:
The liberation of the mind of equanimity is a dharma that an arhat protects, cherishes, and holds dear.
An arhat well protects and cherishes, thinking, May I not fall away from this dharma.
It is like a mother with only one child, who always loves and watches over her with eyes that never leave her.
The mother nurtures, protects, covers, and cares for her, so that she is neither cold nor hot, neither hungry nor thirsty, and has no worries.

In the same way, the liberation of the mind of equanimity is a dharma that an arhat protects, cherishes, and holds dear. An arhat well protects and cherishes, thinking, May I not fall away from this dharma.
For this reason, the liberation of the mind of equanimity is called loved.
Are all the equanimous liberations associated with the knowledge of destruction?
Answer:
Or the equanimous liberations are not associated with the knowledge of destruction.
How are the equanimous liberations not associated with the knowledge of destruction?
Answer:

The equanimous liberations of an arhat, the unlearned equanimous views, and the mind associated with them, the liberation that has been liberated, and that which will be liberated in the three times - this is called the equanimous liberations not associated with the knowledge of destruction.
How are those associated with the knowledge of destruction not equanimous liberations?
Answer:

The knowledge of destruction of an arhat who is free from doubt, and the mind associated with it, the liberation that has been liberated, and that which will be liberated - this is called associated with the knowledge of destruction but not equanimous liberations.
How are the equanimous liberations associated with the knowledge of destruction?
Answer:

The equanimous liberations of an arhat, the knowledge of destruction, and the mind associated with it, the liberation that has been liberated, and that which will be liberated - this is called the equanimous liberations associated with the knowledge of destruction.
How are those neither equanimous liberations nor associated with the knowledge of destruction?
Answer:

The mind liberation associated with the non-doubt dharma arhat's cognition of non-arising and the unlearned right views, which has been liberated, will be liberated, and is now being liberated, is the mind liberation not associated with the cognition of exhaustion.
Are all the non-doubt mind liberations associated with the cognition of non-arising?
Answer:
Yes, all those associated with the cognition of non-arising are non-doubt mind liberations.
Are there any non-doubt mind liberations not associated with the cognition of non-arising?
Answer:
Yes, the mind liberation associated with the exhaustion cognition of the non-doubt dharma arhat and the unlearned right views, which has been liberated, will be liberated, and is now being liberated.
What is the illumination of the learner? What is the knowledge of the learner?
What is the illumination of the learner?
Answer:
It is the wisdom of the learner.
What is the knowledge of the learner?
Answer:
It is the eight knowledges of the learner.
What is the illumination of the post-learner? What is the knowledge of the post-learner?
What is the illumination of the post-learner?
Answer:
It is the wisdom of the post-learner.
What is the knowledge of one beyond training?
Answer:
The eight knowledges of one beyond training.
When practicing the Dharma, what faith does one first attain - the Buddha, the Dharma, or the Sangha?
Answer:
When practicing the Dharma of suffering, the Dharma of accumulation, the Dharma of cessation, and the Dharma of the path, it is the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha.
How many of these four inversions have been eliminated by a stream-enterer, and how many have not been eliminated?
Answer:
All have been eliminated.
How many of these three concentrations has a stream-enterer accomplished in the past, how many in the future, and how many in the present?
Answer:
All are accomplished in the future. If they have already ceased and have not been lost, then they are accomplished in the past. If they are present, then they are accomplished in the present.
If a path is in the past, have all those paths already been cultivated and relied upon?
Answer:
It is so. If a path is in the past, all those paths have already been cultivated and relied upon.
Is there a path that has already been cultivated and relied upon, but is not past?
Answer:
There is, namely the future path that has already been cultivated and relied upon.
If a path is future, is all that path not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon?
Answer:
There may be a path that is future, but not one that is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon.
What is a path that is future, but not one that is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon?
Answer:
The future path that has already been cultivated and relied upon - this is a path that is future, but not one that is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon.
What is a path that is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon, but is not future?
Answer:
The path that has not yet been attained and is present - this is a path that is not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon, but is not future.
What is a path that is future, but not yet cultivated and not yet relied upon?
Answer:
If the path is future and has not yet been cultivated and relied upon, this path is future and has not yet been cultivated and relied upon.
What is meant by a path that is not future, and this path is not one that has not yet been cultivated and relied upon?
Answer:
The past path originally attained and manifested in the present, this is called a path that is not future, and this path is not one that has not yet been cultivated and relied upon.
If a path is manifested in the present, are all those paths cultivated and relied upon?
Answer:
It is so, if a path is manifested in the present, all those paths are cultivated and relied upon.
Are there paths that are cultivated and relied upon but not manifested in the present?
Answer:
There are, such as when the path that has not yet been attained is manifested in the present, the other future paths of that type are cultivated.
